column4: henk: There is a script called Diskmounter that makes that quick and easy if you dont like manually editing things
yeah but i dont want to type anything just have it mounted and ready when i start ubuntu
you only do it once.. It edits the fstab for you
http://media.ubuntu-nl.org/scripts/diskmounter   save this to your desktop.. go to terminal... cd Desktop   then sudo bash diskmounter
well it did but it aint automounting when i reboot :p
You should have disk icons on your desktop after restarting x...
have AmiDaniel_away look at your fstab.. something may be up or a previous edit is keeping them from mounting.. I have seen that a few times..
I can only stay a minute.. the wife is giving me thet "LOOK"
Are you seeing the first partition of your second drive?
the only way i can mount the windows drive manually is by force mounting it
Rem # out lines 9, 10 and 12 and rerun diskmounter...
